definition: great person of the past/venerable forebear/the great and the good
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation

sentences.english: B. practices: replacement of the Witan, with Grnd council, Domesday Book.
sentences.chinese: 威廉用大議會取代賢人會議，還編寫《末日審判書》。

sentences.english: Other men of worth are mounds and hillocks , which may be surmounted.
sentences.chinese: 其他的賢人好比是丘陵，還是可以超越的。

sentences.english: There's a Russian proverb that goes: you must support the most talented people because untalented people will support themselves.
sentences.chinese: 有一句俄羅斯諺語說，你須擁戴賢人，庸者僅會自顧。

sentences.english: I never was able on questioning to understand if they consider Buddha a prophet, wise man or a God.
sentences.chinese: 我毫不質疑他們把佛陀當作了一個先知，賢人或上帝。

sentences.english: "Hey, just look at us, which other country has a moral colossus to match Nelson Mandela?"asked
sentences.chinese: 嘿，看看我們，哪個國家有曼德拉那樣的賢人？

definition: kindhearted and moderate (idiom); temperate and gentle
name and reality/how sth is portrayed and what it is actually like
On learning, classic book by Confucian philosopher Xun Zi 荀子 (c. 310-237 BC)
"universal love", principle advocated by Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3], stressing that people should care for everyone equally
after that, any remaining energy (idiom from Analects); time for extracurricular activities
to think sth through/to consider carefully
